image.altText: A portrait of 10-year-old Matilda, the youngest victim of the Bondi Beach shooting

props.synopsis: Albanese has announced sweeping reforms to crack down on antisemitism in the wake of the deadly terror attack on Sydney's Jewish community.

title.children: PM announces reforms to combat 'evil scourge'

image.altText: A man stares down the barrel of a camera while sitting in a room, wearing all black.

props.synopsis: The man who stabbed two Australian National University students in 2023 is given a nominated sentence of life to be carried out in a secure mental health facility.

title.children: ANU stabber sentenced to life in secure mental health facility

image.altText: A man in sunglasses speaking to media.

props.synopsis: Shakira Adams had no licence and methamphetamine in her system when she drove a stolen car at least 177 kilometres per hour into Matthew McLuckie's car.

title.children: Tom's son was killed in a horror crash. Today the driver got the maximum penalty

image.altText: A woman with long brown hair in a paramedic uniform sits on a couch holding a baby in her arms.

props.synopsis: Rachel Szigeti was preparing to leave for the hospital to give birth to her second baby when she realised the moment had suddenly arrived. That was when her husband Cedric sprang into action and called paramedics.

title.children: NSW paramedics reunite with baby they unexpectedly delivered at home

image.altText: An office building, with a sign that reads 'ACT Government'.

props.synopsis: A legislative inquiry has criticised the ACT government for aggressively recovering debts from people it found were ineligible for stamp duty concessions.

title.children: Home buyers hit by harsh debt pursuit, inquiry finds

image.altText: CSIRO sign generic

props.synopsis: Just a month after announcing 350 job cuts, the CSIRO has received a funding boost, but proposed job cuts will still happen, the national science agency says.

title.children: CSIRO receives $233m funding boost but up to 350 jobs still to go

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete building with the words "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory" over the entry.

props.synopsis: A getaway driver who helped two teenagers flee the scene of a fatal crash near Parliament House is jailed in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Getaway driver from fatal Canberra crash jailed for more than three years

image.altText: Kendrick holds hit hat and microphone, looking down standing on stage.

props.synopsis: American rap superstar Kendrick Lamar brought the house down at Spilt Milk in Canberra, but it was his interaction with a nine-year-old superfan that stole the show.

title.children: 'We were just crying': Kendrick Lamar serenades 9yo at Spilt Milk

image.altText: A man wears a face covering and black hat as he walks along wearing a black jacket.

props.synopsis: A Bywong man pleads guilty in the Queanbeyan Local Court to aggravated animal cruelty after dragging a conscious kangaroo behind his car earlier this year.

title.children: Bywong man pleads guilty to dragging conscious kangaroo behind car

image.altText: A young wombat on a couch, with a cushion in the background, approaches the camera.

props.synopsis: The ACT government is considering how to better manage the territory's wombat population, in response to challenges being experienced by farmers.

title.children: Advocates concerned over wombat management plan

image.altText: A collage of a person with disability, a hand on a wheelchair and kids throwing a ball

props.synopsis: The government confirms two categories of NDIS providers will be subject to mandatory registration, more than a year after it was handed recommendations for how to implement a new system.

title.children: 'Shape up or ship out': NDIS providers warned as new rules confirmed

image.altText: An image of a boat parked on a suburban street, with parts of the boat blurred.

props.synopsis: Lake Macquarie man Jake Dearie has been refused bail after being charged with depicting Adolf Hitler and Nazi symbols on his boat.

title.children: Man denied bail for 'blatant' alleged display of Nazi symbols on boat

image.altText: Logos of Paramount, Netflix and Warner Bros brought together in one illustration.

props.synopsis: In a letter to shareholders, the board wrote that Paramount had "consistently misled" Warner Bros shareholders that its $US30-per-share cash offer was fully guaranteed, or "backstopped," by the Ellison family,

title.children: Warner Bros rejects rival $163bn bid from Paramount

image.altText: A woman stands arms crossed in front of a pub window covered in Christmas decorations.

props.synopsis: When Leylanie moved her family back to her home town a year ago, she did not expect to be spending this Christmas still living out of a motel.

title.children: Mum pays $1,000 a week to live in a motel in her home town

image.altText: A man in a black suit looks into the camera as he reads from a sheet.

props.synopsis: Charles James Spencer-Churchill, 70, who is known as Jamie Blandford, is the 12th Duke of Marlborough, one of Britain's most senior aristocratic families.

title.children: UK's Duke of Marlborough charged with intentional strangulation

image.altText: Tim Tszyu throws a punch against Anthony Velazquez

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu has dominated against unbeaten American Anthony Velazquez, winning by unanimous decision at the Sydney Entertainment Centre.

title.children: Tim Tszyu comfortably wins on blood-soaked return to the ring

image.altText: Man in patterned shirt smiling, leaning against tree.

props.synopsis: Prostate cancer survivor Mick Barrett is calling on businesses to consider installing rubbish bins inside men's bathrooms to help those with incontinence.

title.children: Sanitary bins aren't always in men's bathrooms. Here's why that's a problem

image.altText: Two cranes against a blue sky.

props.synopsis: The Queensland auditor-general says there will be a higher risk of delays and cost escalations for infrastructure projects ahead of the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games due to shortages in key trade occupations.

title.children: Workforce shortages could 'escalate costs' ahead of Brisbane 2032

image.altText: Donald Trump speaks on the phone.

props.synopsis: When Trump was elected president in 2016, he joined the world's most exclusive and revered club. But three years later, the president added his name to a smaller list of US leaders who'd been impeached.

title.children: The day Donald Trump joined the ranks of impeached US presidents

image.altText: Images of English cricketer Harold Larwood.

props.synopsis: Flying fruit pips are less menacing than the cork and leather cricket balls that Harold Larwood hurled at Australian batsmen during the infamous Bodyline series, but a showdown between the English fast bowler and a disgruntled crowd that was allegedly armed with pomegranate seeds is part of the rich story of Ashes acrimony.

title.children: A Bodyline bowler was pipped by pomegranates, and an uproar ensued

image.altText: A giant golden Oscars Academy Awards statue being loaded onto a red carpet by men standing alongside golden curtains

props.synopsis: The 2026 Oscars are just around the corner but let's give this year's arts award winners just a couple more moments in the sun.

title.children: A fan of awards season? Prove it with our prize-winning quiz

image.altText: A woman sitting at a desk with a laptop.

props.synopsis: Most people spent time doing unpaid work in 2024, according to new data from the Australian Bureau of Statistics. It found women spent on average an hour more doing unpaid work than men.

title.children: These charts show how Australians are spending their time

image.altText: A fire seen through a window.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the cause of a house fire which has left one man fighting for life in hospital and several other people injured.

title.children: Man critically injured in suspicious house fire in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Two people in construction hats look at a drilling rig.

props.synopsis: The Victorian government approves two companies to drill deep underground exploration tunnels amid a gold "renaissance" driven by high gold prices.

title.children: Mining exploration heads underground in Victoria amid gold 'renaissance'

image.altText: A screen shot of a Tamika talking to the camera, long blonde hair, flowers in the hair, low-cut dress, crystal chandelier.

props.synopsis: Police are still waiting to examine a large volume of evidence, including a a post-mortem report in the "complex" alleged murder case involving Tamika Chesser, a court has heard.

title.children: Former Beauty and the Geek contestant's murder case adjourned

image.altText: A woman with short stands in front of the base of a large spotted gum looking friendly at the camera.

props.synopsis: Thought to be 500 years old, a 70-metre-tall spotted gum is almost hidden in the middle of a South Coast state forest. Conservationists want the "world champion" tree and the forest it lives in recognised and celebrated.

title.children: Push to recognise home of 70-metre-tall 'world champion' spotted gum

image.altText: A teenage girl smiling front of a sunset

props.synopsis: Annabelle Klint-Pedersen was celebrating the end of year 12 with friends on the Sunshine Coast when an innocent trip to watch the sunset went tragically wrong.

title.children: Father pays tribute to 'loving' teenage daughter after lookout death

image.altText: A close-up side-on shot of Marlion Pickett with his head slightly bowed.

props.synopsis: Dual Richmond premiership player Marlion Pickett receives a suspended prison term for possessing and dealing with proceeds of crime, in what a judge calls a "line-ball decision".

title.children: Ex-AFL star Marlion Pickett sentenced in 'line-ball decision'

image.altText: The old  railway line leading up to a crossing.

props.synopsis: Talison Lithium rules out reopening a century-old rail line from the world's biggest lithium mine, despite ongoing complaints about truck traffic and dust.

title.children: Miner refuses to revive rail line from world's biggest lithium mine

image.altText: An older man in a suit stands behind a lecturn with another man standing beside him, in front of Noosa council sign.

props.synopsis: The Noosa Council is now blaming human error for a major fraud incident that cost ratepayers millions of dollars — while not acknowledging earlier supplier scam warnings.

title.children: Council says 'human error' cost ratepayers millions in AI scam

image.altText: A screenshot from a security camera shows a masked man walking along a street. A blue circle is around him.

props.synopsis: Police say the footage shows the suspect "casing" the area around the campus before the attack.

title.children: FBI releases footage of Brown University shooting suspect

image.altText: Aboriginal man with blue shirt and tie posing with his award

props.synopsis: Police allege Cyril Mark Yeeda sold $45,000 worth of alcohol in dry communities for $170,000.

title.children: Prominent Halls Creek man faces court for alleged sly grogging

image.altText: A woman kneels next to a massive washed up ray on a sandy beach with another few dead rays behind her.

props.synopsis: Dead rays and sharks found along a regional South Australia beach have been linked to the algal bloom, the government confirms.

title.children: Deaths of rays and sharks blamed on algal bloom

image.altText: Nick Reiner on the red carpet in September 2025

props.synopsis: Prosecutors will charge the son of film director Rob Reiner and Michele Singer Reiner with two counts of murder.

title.children: Nick Reiner to be charged over Rob Reiner's death

image.altText: A man holding a fish

props.synopsis: An important apex predator died out 100 years ago due to overfishing and land clearing. Now, a close relative is bringing balance back to the habitat.

title.children: Apex predator returns to major river system, 100 years after extinction event
